name: Bank armoring or vegetation condition
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Integrates bank geometry, rooting, surface protection, raw or failing banks, and hardening to summarize erosion risk and sediment delivery.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map hardened versus natural or vegetated bank lengths and compute percent by type.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Predominantly natural banks with deeply rooted cover.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Some armoring or partial vegetation coverage.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Large portion of banks is armored or vegetation is sparse.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Failing armoring or widespread bare banks with severe instability.
